website_summaries.verdict: Perfect dimensions for any table or desktop home. The mini heater is effective and safe to use.
pros: An affordable, compact heater that offers energy-efficient operation
It's small, but provides plenty of heat
Isn't very loud and the casing of the ceramic heater doesn't get hot to the touch
Warms up rapidly, and features overheat protection
cons: Heat doesn't travel very far, so you'll need to have it close to provide warmth

customer_reviews.title: Warms up to 2 ft away
customer_reviews.text: This is a tiny heater measuring about 4.5"x6". I bought it to keep my hands warm in my office. They call this a personal heater for a reason - it only heats up the immediate surroundings. My office usually runs about 68 degrees. I took temperature measurements as close as 6" away from the heater and as far as 3 feet away. You can barely feel the heat any further than 2 ft from the unit. I gave it 5 stars because it lives up to its name and gets the job done. But if you want to warm up an entire office cubicle you're better off getting something a bit bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: My brother is a cheap jerk who keeps the heat ...
customer_reviews.text: My brother is a cheap jerk who keeps the heat, if you can call it that, at 66 degrees when it is 15 degrees outside in the dead of winter. I smuggle this heater into his house and use it in the bedroom whenever I stay over, which is not often. It is very small and quiet. It heats the room just enough so that I am not freezing my balls off at night. I probably bumps up the temperature to about 69 or 70, which is within the bearable range.
customer_reviews.author: Magic Mike

customer_reviews.title: Left it on for 84 hours by accident
customer_reviews.text: I had just ordered this little thing to warm my toes in my cold office, which it did just fine. But it's earned my lifelong appreciation for not burning everything down after I forgot it was on, on Thursday night. I thought it was uncharacteristically warm in my office on Monday, and there it was, humming along cheerfully under my desk. To sum up: Keeps my toes warm, didn't burn down my office and kill the people in the four apartments upstairs in their sleep. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: David Traver Adolphus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect office contraband heater!
customer_reviews.text: This little heater is perfect if you need a little extra warmth at your desk. It's practically silent, which is a huge plus for hiding heaters that are against company rules. So long as you keep it within a few feet, you'll get plenty of heat to take the chill of a cold office. It will not heat up your whole cube or office, so you won't hear complaints from those weirdos who are hot all the time. And so what? Who wants to share their precious heat with those jerks anyway? Since it's low wattage, there's less of a chance of blowing out a block of breakers in your crappily wired office building. Stay toasty, my friends!
customer_reviews.author: FancyFeet

customer_reviews.title: Not good for office space
customer_reviews.text: This little heater is compact, fits easily on the shelf or desk, seems well made but puts out very little heat. I have to hold my hands up next to grate to get them warm. I’ve even stuffed it up my shirt to warm up. It puts out a VERY minimal amount of heat. Might be good to warm up a closed file drawer but doesn’t make a dent in a 5x5 office even with door closed. If you want a space heater that will get an area warm and toasty pick something else.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: I got this in September 2018 but only used it a few times when office AC became ridiculous. I don't believe I used this more than 10 times for an hour or so this whole winter... probably even less.....When my office got their AC problem sorted out I put the little heater away and only got it out today when I needed to blow some hot air unto my shirt that got wet under the rain. Heater worked for about an hour and then just DIED. Dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Alla

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this heater
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this heater. Bought it for my office desk. Keeps me warm when the guys I work with are trying to freeze me out with the A/C set to Antarctica temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Little_Red_77

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for dollhouses and 1-hamster habitat. Can't do more than that.
customer_reviews.text: "personal heater" as in "if it's farther away than 6" you won't feel a darn thing" type. I got it to heat up a tiny 1 /2 bathroom (5'x5') and with closed door and window you can't feel the room any warmer even after an hour. I went for small because I didn't see the reason for using a lot of power in such a small space. This is a toy, not a personal heater.
customer_reviews.author: Doina "Day" Berndt dba Kalyana Design

customer_reviews.title: As best as I can tell the only way that would ...
customer_reviews.text: I somehow thought this would heat a tiny bathroom. As best as I can tell the only way that would happen would be if it caught on fire. When I read “Personal Heater” I didn’t realize I would have to hold it in my lap and put my hands ON it. It was truly, for me, a complete waste of money. If you need a heater for a very...VERY small dog house, maybe this might work IF the dog laid on it.🙄
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Johnson

customer_reviews.title: No bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: This is quite possibly the worst heater ever made on the planet. It is so small and the output is so tiny it won't even warm up your feet. Save yourself some money and get a heater that has a little bit more wattage and a bigger footprint. You'd be better off rubbing your hands together over using this heater. I couldn't even use it to keep a closet warm, which is what I had bought it for; that's how bad this product is. Stay away from this teeny tiny horribly constructed heater.
customer_reviews.author: tomfromboston

customer_reviews.title: great spot warmer
customer_reviews.text: this is clearly advertised as a personal heater, not a room or house heater. seems like every bad review is someone who cant read and wanted more heat. this was exactly what I wanted. just a spot warmer that uses little electricity. built solid and compact. I bought 4 more of these as gifts for my coworkers. they all loved them. even though the lack of a tip-over kill switch prohibits their use in my office, they work great everywhere else a little supplemental warming is needed: small bathroom, camper, nightstand, on the floor under your desk, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Greg D

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: You can't regulate the temperature, that's OK though. It gives plenty of heat in small spaces. I used it under my desk at work.... Which was a cubicle. Other coworkers let me borrow there's from time to time. I liked it so much I got my own. Also good.... It doesn't pull lots of current. You won't have to worry about tripping the power source when you use it.
customer_reviews.author: pinky

customer_reviews.title: Lacks Tip Over Switch
customer_reviews.text: I learned through this purchase that it is possible to sell an electric space heater without a tip over switch. Not a flaw in the product description, I just had never seen an electric space heater without a tip over switch. Yes, there is a thermal overload switch that probably ought to turn it off if it overheats but probably is not good enough for me at least. Too fraught with risk to use, or in good conscience to donate for others to use, and the cost to ship it back approaches the cost of the unit. Into the landfill it goes. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: CMC

customer_reviews.title: Smoke on 1st use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heater to put under my desk at the office and the second I turned it on it started smoking and smelt like burnt plastic. I thought maybe it was just burning off the initial layer but after 30 minutes the air never warmed up. It is also very small and probable made for a deskTOP due to the radius the air could be felt.
customer_reviews.author: Micah C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little heater, but could use improvements
customer_reviews.text: Nice heat, but has room for improvement, with Technology advancing Im sure they can lower wattage and still squeeze out more heat. does well enough for a small space, as intended. Noise...its noisy. Safety:there is none lol, touch the outside of that heating element in the front, and your *** is in for a world of hurt! No tipping safety switch, just heat. No low or high setting...just On. Ok wattage, I pull about 190 steady when on, but it will have a 300-350 start up wattage jump. It evens out soon after. When combines with a good lithium battery  I got about 1hr-30min.
customer_reviews.author: D. Logan

customer_reviews.title: It should be classified as a hand warmer
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small heater to put in the bathroom while I bathed my son. I don't like cold bathrooms, so I wanted to make sure he was as comfortable as possible too. This little heater is not powerful at all. It should be marketed as a hand warmer, because that's about all it's good for. The unit is small and portable. But don't expect it to kick out much heat at all. You have to be quite close to feel anything coming out. I know this is a "personal" heater, and not a space heater, but I still expected more.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent desktop heater
customer_reviews.text: This thing is perfect for your desktop. The spot heat is great. I have it about 6 inches from my keyboard and the heat keeps my hands/head/neck/face toasty. And it only uses 200 watts (not 500-1500 like room space heaters) so I have it plugged into a power strip with no problem. It has a quiet, soothing sound and a solid on-off button. Seems very well-made and safe. It is definitely not designed to heat up a room, but for a small space like on your desk it's the best!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Mite!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing packs a hot punch. You do need to be sitting close to it, but if you are, it delivers heat quick and quiet. You'll probably end up turning it off in less than an hour because you'll feel too hot. Not a lot of controls on it, but hey look at the price! This thing outperforms much larger and more expensive heaters. I've tried plenty of different varieties of space heater. None delivers more bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: jazmaan

customer_reviews.title: It gets hot, but you basically have to be directly in front of the unit to feel any heat
customer_reviews.text: Its ok, yes it does get hot but your hands or feet have to be less than 6 inches away from the unit. Pros: - cheap - small -energy efficient Cons: - no temp adjustability - very small amount of heat output - Must be very close to the unit to feel the heat
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome desk heater
customer_reviews.text: Love my desk heater. I got it as I work at a call center. With the weather getting colder and my work always having the temp at 70 I needed something to keep my hands warm due to the occasional carpal tunnel. This works perfect and it's quite to not disturb others or call to much attention. Other than not being able to adjust temperature it's perfect for what I need, and I bought it knowing I couldn't adjust it so I didn't dock for it.
customer_reviews.author: florg29

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Heater
customer_reviews.text: This heater has no temperature control (thermostat). It is either on or off via the switch on the front. I have it plugged into a separate thermostat for control in a grow tent/greenhouse for orchids in winter. Regular space heaters were way too much for this tiny, enclosed space but the 200 watt output of this heater is perfect. It's gentle heating avoids temperature spikes and it's not so hot that it burns plants. If you want this to heat a room or keep your feet warm under a desk I would say it's too small. But, for my unusual use it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: As Described- this is a SMALL PERSONAL SPACE HEATER
customer_reviews.text: This product is described perfectly. It is an INDIVIDUAL personal space heater. I bought it to be used in my bathroom to take the chill off this winter. Our bathroom is about 10 feet wide and 8 feet long. It's small. Using this heater did nothing to take the chill off. I bought it knowing it was a personal space heater and hoped it would do the trick for such a small space - but it did not. So, if you are using this to heat anything other than your legs or upper body- don't. It isn't meant for heating spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I just received this yesterday so I can't really speak to how it will last over time, but I am very impressed with how much heat this little device puts out. There is only one option - on or off - so no real flexibility there but it is attractive and takes up very little space on my desk. The only thing I would wish for is an option to run it on batteries because it would really come in handy when our electricity goes out, but for the price, and from what I've experienced so far it's easy to recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MartyH

customer_reviews.title: Most Importantly, It's Cute!
customer_reviews.text: This sits on the desk in my very cold office. Puts out a good amount of heat, is quiet, and doesn't feel hot to the touch anywhere but the actual grate where the heat comes out. The only con is that it's either on or off, no settings for different heat levels. I feel very safe with this in the office and have no worries about fire or burn danger; I joke its a glorified hair dryer without the noise. The heat isn't thrown very far, but I can sit a few feet from it and experience its benefit. Nice for not disturbing your neighbor at the next desk who might not be as cold as you.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia G.

customer_reviews.title: Good heater for an office desk
customer_reviews.text: This heater puts out just enough heat to warm the area under a desk. By limiting the power consumption to 200W, the heater also does not pop a circuit breaker in the office as a typical larger heat would do when sharing circuits in an office environment. The power switch is on/off, there is no adjustment nor does there need to be. It also does not seem to have a tip switch as it continues to blow if knocked over. However, the heating element is enclosed so little chance for fire if tipped. Overall, this is a wonderful little heater at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hise

customer_reviews.title: Great little heater!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my office desk since my office feels like -15 every day of the year. Really puts out a significant amount heat for how compact it is. Definitely gets the job done and didn't cost me a TON. If you are looking for something with safety tip features this is not for you. It really only turns on and off with a switch and has no timer or tip sensor. The ceramic plating keeps the outside form getting hot so it's impossible to burn yourself if you touch the casing. Great little affordable heater for any little space!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: A LOWER POWERED BARGAIN HEATER
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and well packaged, At only 200 watts this is a PERSONAL heater, which means you need to have either a very small area to heat or you have to be very close to it. I use it in a moderately sized interior bathroom to take a bit of the chill off while shaving. It does what I expected it to do and it does manage to bring the room temperature up a bit. It is a good value and product if you understand its limitations and have a need for a very physically small heater.
customer_reviews.author: Alan F. Jordano

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this personal heater.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little heater so much. No it doesn’t have any safety features or temperature controls but when I’m freezing at work this little guy does the job without affecting anybody else and without drawing much attention (since we’re not exactly allowed to use them at work!) It’s a personal heater, not a space heater and not a room heater. If you’re looking for one of those, this is not it. But if you’re looking to keep yourself toasty at your desk, this little dude does the job perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Alleycat Woman

customer_reviews.title: Nice Price but just didn't put out the heat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my bathroom to warm up on chilly mornings. I didn't have high expectations, but did hope for some bit of heat. No such luck with this unit. I have it on my bathroom countertop, so it's about waist level. Standing directly in front of it I cannot feel any heat output. I didn't expect it to heat up the whole bathroom but at least warm me up as I stood in front of it. Disappointed with this purchase and would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RNRWK

customer_reviews.title: Takes slight chill away...
customer_reviews.text: Working magically. I sleep with it next to my bed on my bureau, which my bureau is perfect height. Glad I ordered, now that autumn is around the corner. I don’t go to bed or wake up with stiff joints. Just enough heat to take slight chill out of the room if I keep door closed. Not a huge bedroom. Cozy. Fits what I’m looking for. Useful in the shower room for sure! Helps keep the furnace off for a bit longer. Of course, an option of automatic shut off would be nice, but it’s safe enough for how I’m utilizing it. But always take precautions with any heating device.
customer_reviews.author: Vianca

customer_reviews.title: Great for price. Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Great little desk heater. Bought this to use at work during the winter and when I feel a draft come in from my windows. I like the on/off switch and I like that the heat portion doesn’t start all the way at the bottom of the unit. I move all my papers when I get my heater out as a safety precaution but I still like the design cuz it won’t burn my hand either when I’m using my mouse. It is very warm and its nice but some sort of temperature control and direction/angling/swiveling would make this little unit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: M P S

customer_reviews.title: Great little heater
customer_reviews.text: This a good little heater. I use it on my desk at work and it puts out enough heat to keep me comfortable. It's not going to heat a whole room but it works great if you're just trying to heat up a small personal space. I've recently bought one to give to someone else because I'm so impressed with mine. It's still going strong after over two years of use. I think this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Best, High Quality and Hot As You Need
customer_reviews.text: Really Great Heater. Would definitely recommend to anyone in search of a desk heater. But don't take this one for a joke. This bad boy puts out heat like any larger heater. In this small form factor that's a bargain for the price. It's quiet and immediately gets hot for your use. It just looks amazing and high quality when you open the box. There's no way to adjust the temperature but you don't buy a heater to put it on "low". My office building is freezing so I need it as hot as possible to keep me warm.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Simon

customer_reviews.title: Cute and effective!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a very cold single office, and my regular heater kept blowing the fuse. Fortunately this cute little Lasko hasn’t done that once, and it’s perfect to keep right next to my feet so I stay toasty. In an enclosed space, the heat builds to a point where I need to shut it off occasionally. Overall super pleased with its simplicity, size, and efficiency! I’ve used it for a few months now, no issues even though I keep rolling my chair over the cord and accidentally kicking it over.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sansguiri

customer_reviews.title: Button light too bright
customer_reviews.text: Nice little heater. It puts out some warm air in a small area. Small, but efficient. My only real complaint is this - I wanted to use near my bed when I sleep to keep my head warm, but the button lights up so bright, I had to place electrical tape over it to block out all the light. I don't like having to do that, though, because I'm afraid I'll forget to turn it off in the morning. I just wish the light wasn't so bright. Other than that, it's a good little heater.
customer_reviews.author: K. Winkler

customer_reviews.title: Great for the size
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is great for small areas, like a desk space. I have it at my work to keep me warm. It does very well, though I live in a temperate climate, so it doesn't get much colder than 36 F at teh coldest. It doesn't heat a wide area. I put it under my desk to warm my legs and that works better than having it at chest-level. If you're looking for a heater to warm a larger area, this isn't it. It's just a spot heater.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Makes for a cozy office
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this little heater for a few days, but so far I love it! Despite there being heat, my work office is always slightly cooler than is comfortable for me, so this heater has proved to be a perfect solution thus far. It's small, so easy to transport and non-intrusive on my desk. There's only one heat setting, but it's great for warming up my hands and bringing my desk space up a few degrees temperature-wise without being too hot. It's also fairly quiet, which is something I was looking for. Definitely recommend if you're looking for a personal heater and like me am often cold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping in my truck
customer_reviews.text: Bought this heater about a year ago specifically for my Toyota Tacoma because it has a 400w wall outlet in the bed so this heater is perfect since it only requires 200w. I have a camper on my truck for camping trips and sleep in the back but it gets really cold at night since it's not very insulated back there. I finally used the Lasko space heater for the first time and it worked perfect, in fact it worked too good. It made the bed of my truck so warm that I had to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: jorge garcia

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Desk Heater for One
customer_reviews.text: Great, attractive little heater for my desk. I share an office with office mates of varying temperatures. One person complains if I use the larger room heater. This solved the problem! The output is just enough for the person sitting in front of it and does not heat the entire room. I also like the low wattage which will prevent tripping the circuit breaker. There is no temp control only consistent heat. I have zero complaints really.
customer_reviews.author: Blksquirrel419

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small individual space, YES BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little space heater. I just watched my old faithful take her last breath and catch on fire literally. This is such a nice little addition and I dont have to worry about too much heat or fires. It does put out heat but its such a small amount its not dangerous like my other one was. Its also quiet . Its not for someone wanting a great deal of heat so dont buy if you need alot. Its perfect for me though !!! ONLY 200 W, my electric bill will look much better now too.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Just right for a personal heater... not so much for heating a room
customer_reviews.text: This is smaller than I expected but puts out just enough heat for me. I am hot natured, but sometimes during the winter my classroom gets cold when I am working after hours. This little heater is perfect to put beside my feet or hands to keep me comfortable. If you are looking for a small heater... or if you need to hide it easily, this will fit in and office desk drawer with no problem. If you are looking to hear an entire room and not just your feet, I would look for another heater. If this review was helpful, don't forget to click the button: THANKS!
customer_reviews.author: ASPoston

customer_reviews.title: Good personal heater. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little personal heater!! Love it! Can't feel it from a long distance away. But if it's left on, it can heat a small to medium size bedroom. I leave it on 24/7 and don't have to keep turning it on/off to control the temperature. It stays at a "just right" temperature. Would definitely recommend if you're looking for something for a small/medium size space. It doesn't take a very long time to heat up the room. 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Ciara Rachel

customer_reviews.title: If your at work and  anemic like me!
customer_reviews.text: This heater is so cute and tiny! It’s perfect! It’s great for personal use. My coworkers beside me doesn’t feel a thing! It’s keeps me warm and toAsTy! The delivery was awesome! It was well packaged. Nothing came damaged. The only thing is it doesn’t have and temperature control, which is fine it doesn’t get too hot or not hot enough it’s perfect and you can always turn it off when you get too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: I really like this heater.  It's perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Motorcycle-Camper, and I needed a heater for the tent that packed small (this one does), and uses very little wattage. This only draws 200 watts! Yet it is warm, quiet, well built and it keeps me warm in the tent on cold nights. It does NOT have a thermostat or fan speed switch. Just an ON-OFF. Period. But for the price, it's fantastic, and it works perfectly for my moto-camping needs! No more blown breakers by a 1,000 watt tent heater. This little 200 watter does just as well in my 3 person dome tent. On cold nights, I use TWO, and that's still only 400 watts. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Billy B

customer_reviews.title: Great for Tortoises!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for heating my tortoise vivarium! It keeps it at about 90F degrees. It is relatively quiet and very reliable. I use this as opposed to ceramic heat bulbs. This has saved me so much money! I never have to replace ceramic bulbs!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Shult

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little Heater
customer_reviews.text: This is the ideal table/desk top portable heater. We fight over this in our household and just love it. There are no safety or temperature controls, so rather than stars, there should have been an N/A category. I gave each of those categories one star because there is just a simple on/off switch. There is no auto off, but given that this is right in front of you, it would be fairly hard to leave it on if you left your office for the day.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Varna

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little heater. I was expecting it to have a little stronger output. The heat output only reaches about 1-2 feet which is good for small space and close proximity. I purchased this to use in the office. My office space is open cubicles, this heater is enough to take the cold edge off but I’m still left a bit chilled on colder days. Our office does not have heating and they have to kept he a/c on to keep the air circulating so it is often cold.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B

customer_reviews.title: Heat range is just a few inches
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would solve my problem of constant cold feet at work but it doesn’t. It’s very small, which is fine to hide from the snitchy safety guy but it just doesn’t blow enough warm air to make any difference I havento put my feet 2 inches from it to get any warmth but then it starts to burn my skin. The heat range is too small for this to be of any good to me.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for work. I’m a nurse & the hospital is freezing at night. I put it on the desk next to my computer. Everyone wants to steal my heat all the time! I leave it on for hours. There’s no temperature control. Only on & off button. As far as safety the heater itself doesn’t get hot. I’m not sure if it would turn off. I leave it on for at least 6hrs of my shift. I’m satisfied. It does the job.
customer_reviews.author: S. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great for heating up a small room
customer_reviews.text: I've had this heater for over a year and it is perfect. I got it because I was looking for a small heater for my office that wouldn't pull too much power and risk tripping a circuit breaker during the winter when everyone has these going. While it's true that you can't feel it blowing heat on you from more than 2 feet away, it takes only about ten minutes to make my office (about 10' by 10') very toasty. It is also very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole S

customer_reviews.title: Does not put out and lacks safety features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knowing it would not put out a lot of heat. I needed something to heat up my immediate surroundings and this seemed to do just that based on other reviews. However, it does not. I have to put my hand directly in front of the opening to get any warmth. Hand warmers would be more effective. Also, there is no temperature control. Just an off and on switch. There is no tip-over safety feature.
customer_reviews.author: A Turtle ✅

customer_reviews.title: Small, but perfect
customer_reviews.text: We took this little heater camping with us in our van to be able to just take the nip off if it got cold. As it is a personal heater, it does work best if you are right in front of it, however, it did keep our van and us warmer by 10 degrees from the outside temperature. We would buy again and I plan to use it at my work station this winter.
customer_reviews.author: drynard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for close use
customer_reviews.text: I use this heater to take the chill off my right side when the AC kicks on at work. There's a vent right above my desk, so sometimes it feels like winter is descending on me. I keep the heater within 2-feet of my chair, and it counteracts the cold air nicely. And because it doesn't use a lot of power, I know it's not going to trip the circuits. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Tolana

customer_reviews.title: Great personal heater - not a room heater
customer_reviews.text: These are tiny. My office is a frame home on blocks. In the winter, the cold air blows under the house and in the corner where my desk is, my feet and legs get cold, even though the office is relatively warm. Works perfect to warm my feet and legs. The heat blows up from under my desk keeping me warm, and it doesn't use much wattage. I wouldn't expect it to heat a room! But for just heating your legs or body? It's great! Used it all last winter.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I wanted it for...
customer_reviews.text: You have to have the right expectations of this little heater. I sit in front of three large glass windows in an office bldg in downtown Chicago; our mgr keeps the space cold as HAIL (61 degree working environment in the winter); and my entire upper body stays warm while I'm at my desk. I love this thing! Attached is a picture of it as I write this review...enjoy! This heater sits about 1.5 feet away from me on my desktop, and keeps my entire upper body warm
customer_reviews.author: -b

customer_reviews.title: Gives you enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put at my desk while i work. I didn't want nothing to big or something i had to put on the floor. This was very compact. I was surprise of the heat it did put out. It kept me warm at a steady temp. Just plug in and turn on. It also didn't make a lot of noise surprisingly as most make that humming sound while on. I recommend this product for small space use like a cubical. It will not heat a whole room as it was not made for that, but it will keep you warm at a desk while you work.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Mallory Jr

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Desk Heater
customer_reviews.text: This puts out the perfect amount of heat for cold feet under an enclosed desk. My only complaint with it is that it does not flow as much air as I would like, allowing the warm air to travel up more instead of down toward my feet where I need it. UPDATE: I wrote this review when it was $19.99. Now at half the price, I would not balk even the slightest.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Effective For My Needs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this heater to warm my hands while I'm at the office. Unfortunately, even when approximately 6 inches away, it was not effective at doing so. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Persephone1469

customer_reviews.title: Good for warming your feet/hands
customer_reviews.text: Very cute unit. It's smaller than a 1 gallon bottle of water. There is a on and off switch but no temperature control or speed control. It has one speed and one heat setting. This heater is great for warming your feet or hands. I would not used this to warm up a room. It's too small for that. The heater is quiet and omits a hum. It's similar to how a computer fan would sound.
customer_reviews.author: Q.C

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver at my office
customer_reviews.text: My company's office is frigid! I wear a puffy down vest all day and my nose stays cold. This tiny little heater is a life saver. I puts out just enough heat and is extremely quiet...sounds like a tiny little fan. "My Heat" emits heat immediately upon switching the power on. By word of mouth, 3 more of my coworkers have purchased this product and are extremely happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jung

customer_reviews.title: Great little heater!
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this personal heater. It does a great job for as little as it is. Puts out enough heat in the area that I need it. Cool to the touch and never trips a breaker with its low watt power. It won't warm up an office but will personal space because is what it was designed for.
customer_reviews.author: Joe_D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little heater
customer_reviews.text: My right hand (mouse-hand) gets freezing cold while I work. My co-worker had bought this heater and after a day told me how much she enjoyed it. So I went ahead and purchased it as well. I love it! It doesn't blow off so much heat that my face and body get hot. I do have to prop the back end of it up a bit to angle on my hand properly, but other than that it's does exactly what I want it to do and it's not so large that I can't see over it.
customer_reviews.author: Julia H.

customer_reviews.title: Only for hands
customer_reviews.text: I put this in a very small powder room hoping it would warm up the toilet seat but you can't feel any warmth at all when you open the door. You can only feel warmth if you put your hands right up to the unit.
customer_reviews.author: connie johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great simple small personal heater
customer_reviews.text: for safety, it doesn’t have an auto off switch if heater tips over but it’s so small that may not matter as much. It’s perfect for a personal space. It isn’t very loud. I would recommend this product. It’s very simple to use. You just plug it in and there’s an off/on switch. There are no different heating settings/options, but I’m still happy with this product.l and enjoy using it to heat up. This is my second one as I have one for my office. This is perfect to warm up by your bedside.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Martin

customer_reviews.title: Heating for Aged Pet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my aged rabbit as my house is quite cold in the winter and he would not use the heating pad I got him. It worked pretty well for that purpose, it puts out just enough heat for one pet and didn't get too hot. After he no longer needed it I took it to work as the heat in my trailer is broken. It works for warming your hands up, or for one foot at a time. If you want something that will actually raise the air temp you will need a bigger heater.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Kumquat

customer_reviews.title: Great heater to keep your limbs warm
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this heater to bring to work for my feet. It works really well, but it is VERY small. It is exactly like the description states it is more like direct heat for hands or feet. You will not be heating up any spaces with this item. The only complaint (and very minor) is that it is either on or off. There are no variables on heat level. I am very happy with the purchase and I am using it as intended.
customer_reviews.author: tmb

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT Heather for an office desk
customer_reviews.text: Do your hands get cold in your office? This is the perfect little mini heater for putting in front of your keyboard. Keeps hands warm while typing and warms up the air directly in front of you. Quiet and it can even keep your coffee warmer for bit longer. The only downside I can mention is that it doesn't automatically shut off if if tipped over or left on for too long. For $20 it was a great purchase and mine has lasted me 3 winters of use in New England and is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Shellim

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my desk when it gets a bit chilly (mostly in the winter). It isn't too loud and hot air comes out quickly. It is small which I love so it doesn't take up a lot of space. I liked it so much I got a 2nd one for my bedside table to help me warm up when I crawl into a cold bed in the winter. (I would make sure to turn it off before you go to sleep for safety reasons, I have never done it for more than a couple hours)
customer_reviews.author: Brooke W.

customer_reviews.title: Great as micro-heaters after you play with them.
customer_reviews.text: My needs for this close-up heater are probably not like yours. In cold Boston, I need my feet to be as close to hot heat as much as possible. I have 2 of these heaters- one next to my chair where i spend my days, and one by the foot of my bed. Each is used horizontal and, placed only INCHES away from my feet, keep them warm.
customer_reviews.author: M. Arbo

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed having this heater in our home this winter. I love how the design is simplistic and blends beautifully with a variety of decors. It puts out just the right amount of heat for any chilly rooms and is quiet which makes it easier to relax while staying warm. It's easy to control, and safe to use. These would make wonderful gifts as well, I've received many compliments on ours.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Small space heater does the job for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a small space heater and NOT for heating an entire room. In my case I have a small bathroom with no heat, so I flip it on for about 10 minutes before I take a shower and it takes the chill off. It has a very small profile and it can fit anywhere. With a small room like mine, it does the job well and uses very little energy.
customer_reviews.author: B. Oneil

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift idea for those people who are ALWAYS cold lol
customer_reviews.text: 1)My mother is always cold. Whenever the rest of my family is sweating, she wants to turn the heat on. 2) wanted to get her something she can bring to work as well. This personal heater is such a good idea! It has a lot of power for this little thing lol price is perfect and shipping is great!
customer_reviews.author: Gabi Adragna

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap heater
customer_reviews.text: Occasionally I hangout in my car at nights at the local store to do work on my laptop. However its Winter 1/2 of the time here and cold. This little heater is just what I needed. Something small so it doesnt strain the battery's and inverter in my car and use a ton of power, but good enough to keep my car at a decent temperature.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: perfect size
customer_reviews.text: we are technically not allowed to have heaters but the low voltage output, color, and the quite feature make this unnoticeable at my desk. like most my office has a freeze feature that is on 24/7 and my heated blanket just wasn't cutting it anymore. doesn't have a temperature control but I just move it closer or further away to get the perfect temp. it keeps my hands and upper body nice and cozy warm so I'm not shivering anymore from the air vent that blows directly on me.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Mini heater for mini heat
customer_reviews.text: The unit pumps out hot heat, but at a very limited range. I use this on top of my desk at work and sometimes need to hold it in my lap to really get warm. It also doesn't have any safety features to avoid issues if the unit tips over. In all, it does what I need it to do at my office, but barely.
customer_reviews.author: Christine C.

customer_reviews.title: Great heater for small space for me
customer_reviews.text: I use this heater in a 2ft X 2ft X 3ft grow tent in my garage. In the winter months the garage can get pretty cold even though it is insulated. The garage is heated but I don't like heating the whole garage just to keep the grow tent warm so I use this Lasko heater. I combine this heater with two heating mats under my seedling trays and it keeps the tent warm enough that I can start seedlings and keep them alive without fear of them getting cold shocked in mid winter.
customer_reviews.author: WayneTTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Just enough for my hand!
customer_reviews.text: I have Raynaud's just in my mouse hand. When I saw another reviewer mention they use it to warm up their hand from the AC, I bought it. It has enough heat to keep that hand nice and toasty,but not the rest of my body, which likes it cooler,anyway! The casing keeps cool to the touch, so I am not worried about it being a fire hazard. IMPORTANT EDIT: keep at least 5 inches from hand if using it for this purpose because even though it seems pleasantly hot, long enough and you will wake up with tiny blisters the next day. Not a problem with product itself but user error.
customer_reviews.author: Eudevie

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver if you have cold feeling hands!
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me and always have cold hands and work in a cold office this little heater is a life saver! It is low wattage and an energy saver so no one can complain your running up the power bill. It shouldn't trip any circuit breakers due it it only being 200 watts. I put it directly next to my computer keyboard and the pain i used to experience from my hands being cold is now just a memory. It takes very little space and is quiet enough not to get on your nerves. I highly recommend this desktop heater.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for Work, not recommended for Home.
customer_reviews.text: I put this under my desk at work. 1. I only feel the heat between 6inches and 2feet from the heater. 2. Does not shut off automatically- i forgot to turn it off, it was still running the next morning. Warm, but not hot. 3. Only one button. Turn it on and off. Thats it. Still, its quiet and that is big for me. Alot of people on my office have space heaters and I hate how loud theirs are. I only forgot to turn mine off because after hearing my desk neighbor's heater all day, mine was practically silent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Work in a uncomfortable office where the thermostat is set to 69-70 degrees. I shouldn't have to come to work bundled up like I still live in NY, there's a reason I moved to Florida ! We aren't " allowed" to have space heaters due to fire safety reasons, so this little mini heater is perfect to hide under my desk. It's super quiet and discreet . I can now work comfortably with out my toes, fingers and nose freezing off. Thank you MYHEAT !
customer_reviews.author: Chulapit

customer_reviews.title: Works Too Well?
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews and seems perfect so got for my co-worker who is always cold. Came in great size for wherever you want to keep it... on desk, etc. Seemed perfect! Guess it was too perfect... next thing I know she gave it to her mother since it was such a nice small size, easy to use and gave off good amount of heat! Happy holidays to her mother!?! LOL! At least I guess now I know what I’ll be getting my co-worker for the holidays this year!
customer_reviews.author: JessS

customer_reviews.title: Energy effect and perfect for super small spaces
customer_reviews.text: It’s just an on off little heater so that’s why I gave temperature control 1 star. Otherwise this little cutie gets 5 stars. My office is small and we don’t have electricity wired in yet, so I’m using an extension cord. Bigger heaters were just too much wattage. This one is perfect. Don’t expect it to heat a room (unless it’s running 24/7 then it just might) but it will keep you cozy if you keep it next to you, like I do, sitting on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: kfitz3

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for cold hands at the office
customer_reviews.text: Product is great for heating my mouse hand which gets terribly cold at work. I have tried heated gloves which are too bulky, heated blankets (home office only), and the heat packs most people use when snowboarding. I do place it on its side to get the heat right on my hand (NOTE: there is no buzzer that goes off if this is tipped over so be careful around kids and pets). This is great for heating a small area but will not work to heat a room. Highly recommend as I have been looking for the perfect solution for more than a year. Purchased the white one and it blends nicely with my white desk.
customer_reviews.author: H. Alex

customer_reviews.title: Puts out some heat
customer_reviews.text: This was the only heater allowed at work. Packs a lot of heat for a small unit. I don't like that there's no variable speed just "on". Sometimes it will tip over which can be a hazard. I have it set on the floor and didn't realize I had tipped it w/my chair until I started to smell a burning scent. I don't know if it would have cut off automatically if it over heated.
customer_reviews.author: aleelai

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, ultra-small heater for cubicle!
customer_reviews.text: This ultra small heater is perfect for your cubicle space. It isn't going to heat the entire office, but you will feel the heat, when the heater is directly in front of you, while sitting/working at your desk. There are no safety features to speak of, and there is no temperature control; it's on or off.
customer_reviews.author: ExoticMunchi

customer_reviews.title: Great personal space heater!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty great little heater! I got this for my desk at work and it is perfectly side and gives out just the right amount of heat to warm my little area! A little strange odor on the start up but I just account that for being new. Perfect heater for tiny little area!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Compact Ceramic Heater Must!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the office cube and this pacts a lot of heat and is the perfect size. Don't go this winter without one if your office isn't well heated during the cold months
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Great personal heater, lasted me 2 years!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great personal heater which worked perfectly for my small home desk. I love that it's small enough to put right next to my keyboard to warm my hands while I type. If you are only trying to warm yourself, this will work fine, but it will not heat up a room. I ordered this just over 2 years ago and unfortunately, it just gave out on me. I'm debating between ordering another one or getting an electric blanket instead. I only wish the price hadn't increased by $11 (73%!!) of the price I got it for in 2015.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Marie

customer_reviews.title: No idea had to return
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my daughter asked for it to put under her desk at her office to keep her feet warm. The building doesn't allow space heaters so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Vivi

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t provide enough heat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this during the winter to put on top of my desk at work and it didn’t even provide enough output to keep my hands warm. What a waste. If your office space is large, this won’t warm you up. I ended up returning it because apparently we weren’t allowed to have heaters on top of our desks for safety reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Melis

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I work night shift as a nurse and our floor gets very drafty in the wee hours of the morning. I set this heater on my desk to keep me warm while I chart. Although it doesn’t put off a TON of heat, it’s plenty to warm my hands and face from a fairly close distance. For the price, you can’t go wrong. Have been using this product for several months and it’s not showing any signs of wear. Works as good as new!
customer_reviews.author: Kiley Bugaieski

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product overall. The front sides and rear do not get hot to the touch, which I like because I can store it almost immediately after use. The design and the compact size is very nice. Also fairly quiet. The downside is that it's compact size is designed for VERY small spaces. I've put in our (small) bathroom and left it on overnight and it barely raised the temp. I would suggest using this for under your office desk or something very close proximity to you. In it's defense, the title does read "personal" heater, not "space" heater.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan M. Schmelzer

customer_reviews.title: My Little Helper
customer_reviews.text: I love these little guys. I've bought 4 so far. That's because they stop working after a year. But I literally use it everyday so it feels worth it. They're so compact. I keep one in my napsack and bring it everywhere. I'm anemic and get cold just on my feet. So it's perfect when I feel a chill, but don't want to disturb the temperature of anyone else but me. It also is so small that it never short circuits the outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Karina Karina Karina Karina

customer_reviews.title: Small and efficient!
customer_reviews.text: This is a tiny heater that can be placed on the floor or a desk. It does not heat up the surface it is sitting on which is awesome! It's not much bigger than a large coffee mug. I bought this heater for my office which gets pretty cold in the winter. It heats up the area I'm sitting in without heating up the surrounding area or making it too warm. If you want something to heat up a whole room this will not do that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Since its a seasonal item I love its small size and compactness since it doesn't take ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not meant to warm an entire area. It will only warm you up if you are near it but BOY is it hot. Despite how hot it gets the product itself doesn't seem to overheat. Since its a seasonal item I love its small size and compactness since it doesn't take up a lot of storage space. Everyone whom I have shown it to thinks it's a cute toy but are very impressed once they see how potent it is. I love this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kk

customer_reviews.title: Great desk heater
customer_reviews.text: It’s a small heater about the size of half a toaster but works for me at work. It’s decently quiet which is nice. There is only one temperature setting which is fine. The cord is long which is super nice. I’ve had it for two months now and the heater is still going strong. All though I do notice some drop in hest if I’ve been using it for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Khiggins

customer_reviews.title: Great Lil Heater
customer_reviews.text: To say it's only 200-Watts, it's really all the heat I need to warm me up while sitting at work desk for about 2 to 3 hours. Note, when you turn this little heater on, it does NOT automatically turn itself off like several heaters to. With this one, YOU will need to turn it off once you're warm enough. Letting folks know this, so you don't turn IT on and leave it running thinking it will automatically turn off.... IT WONT.
customer_reviews.author: Majoli

customer_reviews.title: If your office is cold, you need this little guy
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because of the size of this thing, that it wouldn't be able to produce enough heat to keep me warm at my desk. But I was wrong! I put it under my desk to warm up my feet, and it does the trick! It gets pretty hot too which is great. It doesn't have a temperature control, literally just off or on - but when I get too warm, I just move it a little further away. I love this little thing. It's really helped in my frigid office!
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Geck

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I work in an office that has an air conditioner which regularly get placed on the "meat-locker freezing-friggen cold" setting. I have been using this for about a year now on my desk. It is quiet and creates a small area of heat surrounding me and my chair (approx 3'x3'). It does not impact others sitting nearby that prefer the cold temperatures. Most do not even realize I have turned it on. It has made my days much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: MPuglia

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Heater
customer_reviews.text: Love this little heater! Perfect for my needs. Super fast shipping, packaged really well, and it works like a charm. I have a large space to heat, so it doesn't heat a large room, but what I needed it for was for my hands and to keep my area warm from cold drafts, perfect for that purpose! It's also discreet, in case you are in an office that doesn't like space heaters! :)
customer_reviews.author: AMAZONGIRL

product_meta.title: Lasko 100 MyHeat Personal Ceramic Heater, Compact, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackLasko’s MyHeat personal heater series provides concentrated personal heat that’s ideal for your desktop or by your favorite easy chair. Provides safe ceramic warmth while only using budget-friendly 200 watts of power.

Additional features include: 

 * Ceramic heat adds quick warmth with fan-powered delivery
 * 200 watts of concentrated personal warmth
 * Ceramic heat adds quick warmth with fan-powered delivery
 * Compact size



BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: YOUR PERSONAL SPACE HEATER – At 6 inches tall with a 4” x 4” footprint, this cute, small electric heater takes up minimal desktop space and is intended to heat up your immediate space at home or the office. Designed to warm you, not a room. For that, we recommend getting a Lasko 1500-Watt tower heater.

EASY TO USE – No assembly required. Simply take it out of the box and plug it in to a standard 120v wall outlet. This energy-efficient, indoor ceramic heater draws about 2 amps and turns on with a flip of a switch. Compact and portable, MyHeat comes with a 6-foot cord and a 2-pronged plug. It’s also easily stored when not in use.

YEAR ROUND USE – Tired of always being cold at work in the winter? Is your cube right under the AC vent in the summer? If this sounds familiar, then this little heater is just what you need to keep you comfortable year-round. Produces a quiet, white noise that won’t disrupt your co-workers. MyHeat is available in 4 fun colors (black, white, blue, and purple) and makes for a great gift.

TRUSTED FOR GENERATIONS – Lasko has been making quality products for over 100 years. MyHeat is ETL Listed and comes with Automatic Overheat Protection. The on/off switch lights up to let you know the unit is on. The self-regulating, safe ceramic heating element keeps the exterior cool to the touch – taking the worry out of using the heater for long periods of time.
Lower power useage saves on your energy bill and helps to elimanate tripping the circuit breaker if multiple heaters are used in an office setting.

KEEPS YOU WARM AT WORK – At 200-Watts and 682 BTUs, this low wattage mini space heater is ideal for use under the desk to keep your feet and legs warm. Best of all, because it’s low wattage, it won’t keep tripping the office circuit breaker every time you turn it on.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars8,882 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Lasko Myheat Personal Heater, Owner's Manual
